channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan: US ramping up Kabul evacuation effort, says Biden
item.description: American troops expand the perimeter around Kabul airport as thousands hope to escape the Taliban.

item.title: Afghanistan: Afghan woman gives birth to baby girl on US evacuation plane
item.description: The woman went into labour en route to Ramstein Air Base in Germany and gave birth on the plane.

item.title: Storm Henri makes landfall at Rhode Island
item.description: More than 120,000 homes are without power as millions of people warned to expect significant damage.

item.title: Nord Stream 2: Russia must not use gas pipeline as weapon, says Merkel
item.description: The German chancellor says Moscow could face sanctions if it uses Nord Stream 2 against Ukraine.

item.title: Covid: Taiwan rolls out homegrown vaccine amid criticism
item.description: Taiwan's president was vaccinated with the country's first domestically developed jab named Medigen.

item.title: Covid: New Zealand pandemic strategy in doubt amid Delta spread
item.description: The highly infectious Delta variant "does change the game", the Covid response minister says.

item.title: Everly Brothers: US rock 'n' roll star Don Everly dies aged 84
item.description: The rock 'n' roll duo were known for their harmonies and influenced bands including The Beatles.

item.title: French match abandoned after player hit by bottle
item.description: Nice versus Marseille is abandoned after Dimitri Payet throws a bottle back into the crowd and fans storm the pitch.

item.title: Covid: Australian police clash with anti-lockdown protesters
item.description: Hundreds of people are arrested after rallies against lockdown measures in Melbourne and Sydney.

item.title: Poison algae may have killed California family, police say
item.description: A family of three may have been killed by toxic algae blooms on a hiking trail, investigators say.

item.title: Kenya holds biggest ever animal census
item.description: All wildlife on land and sea is being counted to help Kenya's conservation plans and tourism.

item.title: Greece erects fence at Turkey border amid warnings of Afghan migrant surge
item.description: A 40km (25-mile) barrier is placed at the land border amid warnings of a surge of Afghan migrants.

item.title: Why a US military base became a centre for Chinese Covid conspiracies
item.description: Apparent Chinese propaganda efforts are spreading ahead of a US report on Covid-19 origins.

item.title: Kamala Harris joins diplomatic charm offensive in South East Asia
item.description: The US vice-president's trip to the region falls in the shadow of a chaotic withdrawal from Afghanistan.

item.title: C-17: The US military plane carrying Afghans to safety
item.description: A Boeing C-17 safely carried 823 Afghans from Kabul last week, a record number for that plane.

item.title: Nigeria's royal wedding: Private jets, glitz and glamour
item.description: President Buhari's son marries the daughter of a religious leader in one of Nigeria's events of the year.

item.title: Dorothy Butler Gilliam: 'I am not a maid, I am a reporter'
item.description: The first black female reporter on the Washington Post says some colleagues would pretend not to know her.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Women should fight for the right to work'
item.description: A leading campaigner for women's rights in Afghanistan was evacuated from Kabul last week, after going into hiding.

item.title: How Afghanistan's media is changing under Taliban rule
item.description: The Taliban are currently on a media offensive but does their rhetoric match what’s happening on the ground?

item.title: Simone Biles and mental health focus: 'I wouldn't change anything for the world'
item.description: Four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles "wouldn't change anything for the world" because she "gave an outlet for athletes to speak up about mental health".

item.title: The devastating human cost of rising US gun violence
item.description: Deadly shootings are on the rise in many US cities - poorer and black communities are hardest hit.

item.title: 'I play carrom with my feet'
item.description: Twenty-three-year-old Harshad Gothankar was born without arms, but he is now a state carrom champion.

item.title: Afghanistan: Where will refugees go after Taliban takeover?
item.description: Thousands of people are scrambling to flee Afghanistan after the Taliban took control of the country.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: 'Hey world, do you care what happens here?'
item.description: A young woman shares her fears a week after the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: The desperate scramble to escape
item.description: The BBC witnesses scenes of chaos and panic as thousands still crowd Kabul's airport.

item.title: Afghanistan: Sport bodies call for emergency evacuation of female players
item.description: Fifa and players' union Fifpro call on governments to arrange the emergency evacuation of female footballers in Afghanistan.

item.title: Turmoil in Afghanistan hits close to home in America too
item.description: Christine's husband was killed in Afghanistan - she's horrified by the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Biden's week of blame and tumult after Kabul fall
item.description: How the fall of Kabul stunned the Biden administration and spawned the worst week of his presidency.
